typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "LSP4: cannot edit Token Name after deployment"

arguments.value: LSP4: cannot edit Token Name after deployment

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "LSP4: cannot edit Token Name after deployment"

typeDescriptions.typeString: literal_string "LSP4: cannot edit Token Symbol after deployment"

arguments.value: LSP4: cannot edit Token Symbol after deployment

argumentTypes.typeString: literal_string "LSP4: cannot edit Token Symbol after deployment"

devdoc.author: Matthew Stevens
devdoc.details: Implementation of a LSP8 compliant contract.

params.newOwner_: The owner of the token contract

params.dataKey: The key which value to retrieve

returns.dataValue: The data stored at the key

params.dataKeys: The array of keys which values to retrieve

returns.dataValues: The array of data stored at multiple keys

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

params.dataKey: The key which value to retrieve
params.dataValue: The value to set SHOULD only be callable by the owner of the contract set via ERC173 Emits a {DataChanged} event.

setData(bytes32[],bytes[]).details: Sets array of data at multiple given `dataKeys` SHOULD only be callable by the owner of the contract set via ERC173 Emits a {DataChanged} event.

params.dataKeys: The array of keys which values to set
params.dataValues: The array of values to set

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

devdoc.title: LSP4DigitalAssetMetadata

DataChanged(bytes32).notice: Emitted when data at a key is changed

constructor.notice: Sets the name, symbol of the token and the owner, and sets the SupportedStandards:LSP4DigitalAsset key

getData(bytes32).notice: Gets singular data at a given `dataKey`

getData(bytes32[]).notice: Gets array of data at multiple given keys

setData(bytes32,bytes).notice: Sets singular data at a given `dataKey`
